intro: Platystemon mohavensis, commonly known as the Mohave platystemon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
